content: The amenities of life have been chasing my soul. And my mind is transcendental, and I'm losing all control. And I'm sinking in the quagmire of illusions and Thoreau. I cry out "My name is T-Bone" as a hound-dog digs a hole. You ask so many questions, what answers should I choose? Is this Plato's heebie-jeebies or just existential blues?
author: Tom "T-Bone" Stankus
